description: From French ésérine, from éséré, from a West African name for the Calabar bean,  +‎ -ine.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) An alkaloid C₁₅H₂₁N₃O₂, originally extracted from the Calabar bean.
examples: Thomas Fraser (1841–1920) isolated the alkaloid eserine and made the important discovery that another alkaloid, atropine, blocked some of eserine’s actions.
